intro: Vicia tenuifolia var. elegans, commonly known as the slender vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, trifoliate leaves that are often hairy. The flowers are typically pale yellow to reddish in color, arranged in small clusters, and are attractive to pollinators such as bees. This variety is native to Europe and is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds.
